issues.description: The problem statement’s UML specifies that Stock.take(String) should return an int, but in the template repository Stock.take returns a boolean. The solution reference implementation uses an int return type for take. This mismatch will confuse students about the expected return type and lead to compilation or logic errors when they implement SaladSaloon’s order logic.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the return type of Stock.take in the template to int, returning the updated quantity or -1 on failure, to match the problem specification and the reference solution.
